sentences.en: A laudatory speech or written tribute , especially one praising someone who has died.
sentences.cn: 颂词,颂文,悼词:颂词或颂文, 尤指对死者的赞颂.

sentences.en: Beth spoke of Dr. Hammer in laudatory terms.
sentences.cn: 贝丝谈及哈默医生时赞不绝口。

sentences.en: Chicken legs , chicken claws , laudatory title, rich in colloid, with tenacity.
sentences.cn: 凤爪是鸡脚爪的美称, 含丰富胶质, 有韧劲.

sentences.en: Her teaching evaluations are among the most laudatory in this department.
sentences.cn: 她的教学评估,在本系是居最受颂扬者之中.

sentences.en: I don't know why, but O. B a way of disparaging me even while laudatory phrases.
sentences.cn: 我也不知道为什么, 奥. 巴夸我的时候也像在损我一样.

sentences.en: Now , when Carrie heard Drouet's laudatory opinion of her dramatic ability, her body tingled with satisfaction.
sentences.cn: 听到杜洛埃这么称道自己的演戏才能, 她心满意足精神振奋.

words.tran_cn: 值得赞赏地；可嘉地；可佩地
